title: WHM Internal Server Error Debugging and Troubleshooting + Laravel Project Upgrade
description:
Description:

The client’s web application was down due to an internal server error caused by upgrading PHP from version 8.2 to 8.3. This upgrade led to a wide range of server issues. I addressed and resolved numerous technical challenges involving PHP environment setup, server configurations, and application dependencies. This process required extensive troubleshooting and optimization to ensure seamless and reliable application performance.

Responsibilities:

PHP Version Issues:
  • Fixed PHP version discrepancies by ensuring compatibility between different PHP versions used by the server and PHP-FPM.
  • Configured the PHP version for the site, ensuring the correct version was utilized by both the web server and PHP-FPM.
PHP-FPM Service Issues:
  • Diagnosed and resolved PHP-FPM service errors, including fixing the issue where PHP-FPM was not restarting correctly.
  • Checked PHP-FPM configurations and ensured the correct socket directories were set up.
  • Verified the systemctl status and restarted PHP-FPM for specific cPanel accounts to ensure smooth operation.
Permission Issues:
  • Addressed file and directory permission issues that were causing "Forbidden" (403) errors.
  • Ensured the .htaccess file and directories were readable and executable.
  • Configured the .htaccess file and web server settings to resolve permission-related errors.
Server Configuration:
  • Adjusted web server configurations to ensure proper handling of requests and to avoid "Internal Server Error" (500) and "Service Unavailable" (503) errors.
  • Configured ModSecurity rules, firewall, and security settings to prevent unauthorized access while allowing necessary operations.
Composer Dependency Issues:
  • Managed and resolved Composer dependency conflicts by installing and configuring required packages and extensions.
  • Ensured all necessary PHP extensions such as iconv, mbstring, zip, curl, sodium, fileinfo, bcmath, and gd were enabled and correctly configured.
Laravel Upgrade:
  • Upgraded Laravel to use PHP 8.3, ensuring compatibility and improved performance.
  • Performed thorough testing and debugging to ensure the application ran smoothly on the upgraded environment.
Error Resolution:
  • Fixed various HTTP errors including 403 (Forbidden) and 503 (Service Unavailable).
  • Diagnosed and resolved internal server errors (500), ensuring proper server configuration and application functionality.

title: Debugging and Troubleshooting 503 Downtime Issues in WordPress
description:
Description

Addressed and resolved persistent 503 Service Unavailable errors affecting a WordPress site, ensuring improved uptime and reliability. Conducted thorough debugging to identify the root causes of downtime, including server overload, plugin conflicts, and cron job issues. Implemented effective troubleshooting strategies to optimize server performance and mitigate future downtime.

Responsibilities

  • Issue Diagnosis: Conducted in-depth analysis to identify the causes of 503 errors, including server load, plugin conflicts, and misconfigurations.
  • Troubleshooting Plan: Developed and executed a comprehensive troubleshooting plan to address and resolve identified issues.
  • Server Optimization: Implemented server and resource optimizations to handle high traffic and prevent future downtime.
  • Plugin and Theme Review: Analyzed and updated plugins and themes to ensure compatibility and performance.
  • Error Log Analysis: Reviewed and interpreted server and error logs to pinpoint issues and verify fixes.
  • Monitoring Setup: Configured and fine-tuned monitoring tools to track site health and receive timely alerts for potential issues.
  • Performance Improvements: Enhanced overall site performance through caching, database optimization, and server configuration.

title: Debugging and Troubleshooting Stripe Payment Issues in WordPress Tour Master Plugin
description:
Description:

Resolved critical payment issues within the WordPress Tour Master Plugin involving Stripe credit card transactions. The problem was identified during the booking process for tours, where several PHP notices and fatal errors were logged, indicating issues with undefined indices and type errors in Stripe API integration.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzed and identified the root cause of the payment processing errors in the WordPress Tour Master Plugin.
  • Diagnosed PHP notices related to undefined indices for tour-date and tour-dinner-option and resolved them.
  • Addressed fatal errors linked to the Stripe API, including type mismatches and incorrect handling of API responses.
  • Debugged and corrected issues in the plugin's Stripe integration code, focusing on proper data handling and API request formatting.
  • Tested and verified the solution to ensure successful completion of tour bookings with Stripe payments.
  • Provided recommendations for future improvements to prevent similar issues.

Technical Details:

  • Errors Encountered: Undefined index warnings, TypeError in Stripe API calls.
  • Error Logs: Detailed log entries indicated problems with tour-date, tour-dinner-option, and Stripe\Util\CaseInsensitiveArray::offsetGet().

title: WordPress User Authentication Plugin Development with PayPal Payment and Subscription Integration
description:
Description:

Developed a comprehensive WordPress plugin to manage user authentication, PayPal payments, and subscription integrations. The plugin was designed to display user-specific data upon login, enable admin data management via the WordPress dashboard, and provide secure access to personal fitness scores and training programs.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborated with the client to gather and understand requirements for user-specific data display and secure access.
  • Developed custom user authentication features to display specific data upon login.
  • Implemented an admin interface for managing user data, including fitness scores, via the WordPress dashboard.
  • Integrated PayPal payment processing to facilitate the purchase of online fitness training programs.
  • Created user profile pages with tabs for personal information, medical information, and subscriptions.
  • Ensured data privacy and security, particularly for sensitive medical information.
  • Provided functionality for users to edit their profile information and for admins to update medical information.
  • Implemented a feature allowing bulk upload of user fitness scores through Excel.
  • Added a PDF management feature, allowing admins to upload and manage PDFs for each user.

Technical Details:

  • Technologies Used: WordPress, PHP, WooCommerce, PayPal API
  • Key Features: User-specific data display, PayPal payment integration, admin data management, secure user authentication, profile and subscription management, PDF management for users

title: Custom WordPress Map Plugin Development with Leaflet and OpenStreetMap Integration
description:
Description:

Developed a custom WordPress plugin to create map features similar to those on a non-WordPress website. The plugin utilized Leaflet Library and OpenStreetMap API, along with Vue.js, to provide a cost-effective solution while meeting client requirements for displaying dispensary locations.

Responsibilities:

  • Analyzed the client’s requirements to replicate map features from a non-WordPress website using open-source tools.
  • Developed a custom WordPress plugin using Leaflet Library and OpenStreetMap API for map integration.
  • Incorporated Vue.js to enhance the plugin’s functionality and user experience.
  • Designed and implemented algorithms for dispensary search with various locations and geocoding capabilities.
  • Loaded 306 dispensary locations dynamically using Vue.js and JavaScript, avoiding the need to create individual pages.
  • Designed and styled the user interface with CSS and HTML to ensure a seamless and aesthetically pleasing user experience.
  • Ensured the plugin provided a seamless user experience, similar to the reference site using Google Maps API, but at a lower cost.
  • Integrated geocoding and search functionalities to enhance user experience and accessibility.
  • Utilized ingenuity to overcome challenges related to the differences between WordPress and the powerful framework used by the reference site.

Technical Details:

  • Technologies Used: WordPress, Leaflet Library, OpenStreetMap API, Vue.js, CSS, HTML
  • Key Features: Custom map integration, dispensary search algorithms, geocoding, Vue.js enhancement, dynamic loading of locations, user interface design and styling, cost-effective solution

title: Laravel + Vuejs Development of Escort Models Membership Platform
description:
Description:

Developed a comprehensive membership platform for escort models using Vue.js and Laravel. The platform allows administrators to add images and details for each model, enabling interested clients to view profiles and contact the models directly.

Responsibilities:

  • Designed and implemented the membership platform using Vue.js for the front end and Laravel for the back end.
  • Created an intuitive admin panel for adding and managing models' profiles, including images and detailed descriptions.
  • Developed user-friendly interfaces for clients to browse and search for models based on various criteria.
  • Implemented secure contact mechanisms for clients to reach out to models.
  • Ensured the platform is responsive and provides a seamless user experience across devices.

Technical Details:

  • Technologies Used: Vue.js, Laravel
  • Key Features: Admin panel for model management, profile viewing, client-model contact functionality, responsive design

title: Hacked WordPress Site Restoration, Penetration Testing and Security Enhancement
description:
Description:

Restored and secured a client's website after it was attacked and severely compromised by hackers. Conducted comprehensive debugging and troubleshooting, followed by penetration testing using advanced tools to ensure robust security.

Responsibilities:

  • Restored the website from backups and reconstructed lost data.
  • Debugged and troubleshooted issues caused by the hacking incident.
  • Performed extensive penetration testing to identify and fix security vulnerabilities.
  • Utilized tools such as Burp Suite, SQLMap, Kali Linux, WPScan, and OWASP ZAP for thorough security analysis.
  • Implemented security enhancements to prevent future attacks and ensure the website's integrity.

Technical Details:

  • Technologies Used: WordPress, Burp Suite, SQLMap, Kali Linux, WPScan, OWASP ZAP
  • Key Features: Website restoration, debugging and troubleshooting, penetration testing, security enhancements
